title: Facebook tracks 'OceanLotus' hackers to IT firm in Vietnam
text: Cybersecurity investigators at Facebook have traced a hacking group long suspected of spying on behalf of the Vietnamese government to an IT company in Ho Chi Minh City.

title: Facebook will probably be worth more split apart: Stoller
text: Matt Stoller, director of research at the American Economic Liberties Project and author of the book “Goliath” — joins Yahoo Finance Live to discuss the antitrust suits Facebook was hit with by a group of 48 U.S. attorneys general and a separate one by the FTC, and why a restructuring of big tech wouldn't necessarily be a bad thing for stockholders. title: Facebook lawsuits don't show much consumer harm, but must they?
text: The lawsuits filed against Facebook allege the company's pattern of buying up competitors has turned it into a monopoly, but several experts said the complaints fell short on explaining how the social media platform's actions have hurt consumers.

text: Without free internet services, billions will lose their access to the global market. Still, governments continue to attack FB stock.

title: The legal battle to break up Facebook is underway. Now comes the hard part
text: The groundbreaking lawsuits filed against Facebook on Wednesday by state and federal officials represent the gravest regulatory threat the social media giant has ever faced.

title: FTC faces shoestring budget in antitrust case against Facebook
text: Facebook is amassing big legal guns in a looming battle with the US government over antitrust allegations — but the feds are working on a shoestring budget. title: Facebook Is Officially Under Regulatory Review. What It Means for the Stock.

title: Facebook tried and failed multiple times to acquire a mystery competitor that wasn't Twitter or Snapchat, according to the FTC's new lawsuit (FB)
text: Facebook attempted to acquire an unnamed competitor multiple times and failed, according to a new Federal Trade Commission lawsuit filed Wednesday.  "Facebook has tried and failed to buy other companies that have drawn its competitive attention, including Twitter and Snapchat," documents from the suit said. "Similarly, Facebook has made multiple overtures to acquire [redacted] over the years," it reads, with the rest of the sentence is redacted.

title: Facebook and antitrust: The effort to force spinoffs of Instagram and WhatsApp starts a long legal path
text: Facebook Inc. may have to pay a steep price for two of its most important corporate purchases.

title: Analysis-U.S. blessing Facebook deals complicates lawsuit demanding Instagram sale
text: A U.S. lawsuit that could lead to the break-up of Facebook Inc's social media empire may be hindered by the government's role in the company's monopoly building, and a recent dearth of similar cases, legal experts said. In twin lawsuits on Wednesday, the Federal Trade Commission and 48 U.S. states and territories alleged Facebook's purchases of media-sharing apps Instagram in 2012 and WhatsApp in 2014 were part of an illegal pattern to maintain its monopoly in social networki

title: Big Tech's antitrust woes will continue to grow, but will it actually matter?
text: "The threat of antitrust enforcement is almost as effective as enforcement," says Matthew Cowan, a general partner at venture-capital firm Next47.

title: Facebook faces biggest legal battle in years as US officials launch lawsuits
text: Regulators and 48 attorney generals take on tech company over antitrust concerns

title: Breaking down why Facebook is being sued by the FTC and 48 states for predatory conduct
text: Yahoo Finance's Aikiko Fujita and Dan Howley discuss why the FTC is suing Facebook and 48 state attorneys general. Also, Sally Hubbard, Open Markets Institute Director of Enforcement Strategy and ‘Monopolies Suck' Author joins Yahoo Finance Live to discuss why the U.S. government is suing Facebook for alleged antitrust violations.

title: Instagram boss calls TikTok its ‘most formidable competitor'
text: TikTok is giving Instagram the toughest competition it has ever seen, CEO Adam Mosseri said Thursday. In an interview with CNBC, Mosseri described his photo sharing app as “playing catch-up in a lot of ways” to the mega-popular Chinese app, whose US user base has quickly grown to more than 100 million.

title: Breaking Down the FTC Lawsuit Against Facebook
text: Several states along with the Federal Trade Commission have launched lawsuits against Facebook for snuffing out competition through acquisitions. Subscribe to Cheddar Now on YouTube: https://chdr.tv/NowYT

title: The Facebook Lawsuits Explained
text: Regulators accuse Facebook of buying up rivals. Here's what this means for us and Big Tech.

title: 'It's better to buy than compete': The FTC is using Mark Zuckerberg's own words against him. Read the Facebook CEO's crucial emails here.
text: The Federal Trade Commission is suing Facebook over the company's "illegal monopolization" of the market, and it's zeroing in on the social media company's acquisitions of mobile messaging app WhatsApp and Instagram. The lawsuit accuses Facebook of acquiring the companies to neutralize competition instead of building out their own services to compete in the market. The suit is calling for the company to spin-off the two companies, and a separate lawsuit was filed by 48 attorneys general with similar allegations.

title: Instagram's Mosseri: Facebook breakup would hurt Instagram users
text: CNBC's Julia Boorstin reports on how Instagram chief Adam Mosseri is responding to monopoly power allegations facing Facebook and what that means for the Instagram platform, which is owned by the social media giant.

title: Cramer on Facebook antitrust lawsuits: 'Where's the smoking gun?'
text: Facebook extended its losses in the premarket Thursday following Wednesday's announcement that the FTC and a coalition of state attorneys general filed antitrust lawsuits against the social network. The lawsuits accuse Facebook of acquiring its rivals to illegally eliminate competition and are seeking remedies that could result in forcing the company to divest Instagram and WhatsApp.

title: Facebook Allegedly Crossed a Line in Buying Up the Competition
text: The FTC and 46 attorneys general believe the social media specialist violated antitrust laws.

title: Instagram Introduces Its New Reels Shopping Feature, A TikTok Competitor
text: Instagram is on a roll — with new features that include its introduction of shopping to IGTV, its standalone video for Android and iOS smartphones. Also: an Instagram redesign included new tabs to spotlight Shops, its eCommerce section, and Reels, its area for creators' short videos.

title: Facebook Risks Popular Apps in Antitrust Lawsuits
text: Facebook Risks Losing Its Drivers of Growth in Antitrust Lawsuits as the FTC and states' attorney generals target the social media giant and its popular apps, Instagram and WhatsApp.

title: ‘Break Up Facebook' — Antitrust Lawsuit Enjoys Broad Bipartisan Support

title: FTC Accusations Put Facebook Stock Under Pressure
text: Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ:FB) remains under pressure today, following yesterday's news that the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) and 48 states have filed lawsuits against the social media giant, accusing it of anti-competitive practices.

title: Instagram chief Adam Mosseri on new features and antitrust concerns
text: CNBC's Julia Boorstin spoke with Head of Instagram Adam Mosseri about the social media app's launch of a new feature that allows brands and creators to shop within Reels, the short-form video part of the app. While they spoke ahead of the news that the FTC and states' attorneys general filed an antitrust complaint against Facebook, Mosseri also discussed long-standing concerns regulators and lawmakers have about Facebook regarding antitrust.

title: Big Tech's dominance is under threat. Do investors care?
text: Big Tech's stranglehold on America's economy and markets has become a fact. But increasingly, it's not a given.

title: Facebook hit with antitrust probe for tying Oculus use to Facebook accounts
text: Facebook's bad week just got worse: It's being investigated in Germany for linking usage of its VR product, Oculus, to having a Facebook account. The tech giant raised the hackles of the VR community this summer when it announced it would be merging users of the latest Oculus kit onto a single Facebook account — […]

title: Instagram launches shopping in Reels, its TikTok rival
text: Instagram today is launching Shopping in Reels, its TikTok competitor. The new feature was announced in October as something the company had in the works, as part of a ongoing series of shopping-related updates to the Instagram app.

title: Facebook calls the FTC antitrust lawsuit a 'do-over'
text: The Federal Trade Commission and a coalition of attorneys general from 48 states and territories filed two separate antitrust lawsuits against Facebook on Wednesday. The suits target two of Facebook's major acquisitions: Instagram and WhatsApp.

title: ‘It's Hard to Prove': Why Antitrust Suits Against Facebook Face Hurdles
text: The U.S. and states cases against the social network are far from a slam dunk because the standards of proof are formidable.

title: Facebook lawsuits: the biggest tech battle yet, and one that is long overdue
text: The biggest antitrust case in a generation has been compared to the years-long lawsuit against Microsoft in 1998
